required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir (SOF/VEL/VOX) Fixed Dose Combination (FDC) in Adolescents and Children With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-Label, Multicenter, Multi-cohort Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir Fixed Dose Combination in Adolescents and Children With Chronic HCV Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the steady-state pharmacokinetics (PK) and confirm the age-appropriate dose of sofosbuvir/velpatasvir/voxilaprevir (SOF/VEL/VOX) fixed-dose combination (FDC) in pediatric participants with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

clinical_study.why_stopped: SOF/VEL/VOX will not be evaluated in younger age groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: AUCtau of SOF, its Major Metabolite (GS-331007), VEL and VOX.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cohorts 1 and 2 (6 to < 18 years of age): predose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours postdose at Week 2 or 4; Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years of age): predose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, and 12 hours postdose at Week 2 or 4
primary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as concentration of drug over time (the area under the concentration verses time curve over the dosing interval).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Permanently Discontinued Study Drug Due to an Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12) plus 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) at 12 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ 4 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR4)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR4 is defined as HCV RNA < the LLOQ at 4 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ 24 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 is defined as HCV RNA < the LLOQ at 24 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With Overall Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure is defined as: On-treatment virologic failure: Breakthrough (confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after having previously had HCV RNA < LLOQ while on treatment), or Rebound (confirmed > 1 log10 IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment), or Non-response (HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment) Virologic relapse: Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at last on-treatment visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ On Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Develop Resistance to SOF, VEL, and/or VOX During Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Develop Resistance to SOF, VEL, and/or VOX When Treatment is Discontinued
Change in HCV RNA From Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth and Development as Measured by Height Percentiles
Growth and Development as Measured by Weight Percentiles
Growth and Development as Measured by Tanner Stage Assessment
Growth and Development as Measured by Radiographic Bone Age Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth and Development as Measured by C-Type Collagen Sequence (CTX) Bone Turn-Over Biochemical Marker
Growth and Development as Measured by Procollagen Type 1 N-Terminal Propeptide (P1NP) Bone Turn-Over Biochemical Marker
Swallowability of SOF/VEL/VOX Tablets as Assessed by the Participant's Ability to Swallow the Solid Dosage Tablet Formulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of SOF/VEL/VOX Tablets as Measured by a Questionnaire to Assess Acceptability, Including Palatability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment (Week 8 or Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuropsychiatric Assessments as Measured by PedsQL™ Pediatric Quality of Life survey

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old), 8 Weeks
arm_group.description: Direct-acting antiviral (DAA)-naive participants without cirrhosis in Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (400/100/100 mg or a lower dose smaller tablet based on swallowability assessment) for 8 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old), 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: DAA-naive participants with cirrhosis or DAA-experienced participants with or without cirrhosis in Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (400/100/100 mg or a lower dose smaller tablet based on swallowability assessment) for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old), 8 Weeks
arm_group.description: DAA-naive participants without cirrhosis in Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (400/100/100 mg or a lower dose smaller tablet based on swallowability assessment) for 8 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old), 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: DAA-naive participants with cirrhosis or DAA-experienced participants with or without cirrhosis in Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (400/100/100 mg or lower dose smaller tablet based on swallowability assessment) for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old), 8 Weeks
arm_group.description: DAA-naive participants without cirrhosis in Cohort 3 (6 to < 12 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (a lower dose smaller tablet or a non-tablet formulation based on swallowability assessment) for 8 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old), 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: DAA-naive participants with cirrhosis or DAA-experienced participants with or without cirrhosis in Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old) will receive SOF/VEL/VOX FDC (a lower dose smaller tablet or a non-tablet formulation based on swallowability assessment) for 12 weeks.

intervention.arm_group_label: Experimental: Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old), 12 Weeks
Experimental: Cohort 1 (12 to < 18 years old), 8 Weeks
Experimental: Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old), 12 Weeks
Experimental: Cohort 2 (6 to < 12 years old), 8 Weeks
Experimental: Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old), 12 Weeks
Experimental: Cohort 3 (3 to < 6 years old), 8 Weeks

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Consent of parent or legal guardian required
- Chronic HCV infection
- Screening laboratory values within defined thresholds
- Individuals must have a determination of prior treatment status:
- DAA-naive is defined as either:
- Treatment naive with no prior exposure to any interferon (IFN), ribavirin (RBV), or approved or experimental HCV-specific DAA
- Treatment experienced with an IFN-based regimen and no prior exposure to an approved or experimental HCV-specific DAA
- DAA-experienced is defined as prior exposure to a regimen including any DAA (eg, non-structural protein (NS)3/4A protease inhibitor, NS5A inhibitor, or NS5B nucleotide/nucleoside inhibitor)
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of clinically significant illness or any other medical disorder that may interfere with subject treatment, assessment or compliance with the protocol
- Co-infection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), acute hepatitis A virus (HAV) or hepatitis B virus (HBV)
- Clinical hepatic decompensation (eg, clinical ascites, encephalopathy, and/or variceal hemorrhage)
- Pregnant or nursing females
- Known hypersensitivity to study medication
- Use of any prohibited concomitant medications as within 28 days of the Day 1 visit
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Servizio di Epatologia e Nutrizione Pediatrica
Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified external researchers may request IPD for this study after study completion. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.gilead.com/science-and-medicine/research/clinical-trials-transparency-and-data-sharing-policy.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A secured external environment with username, password, and RSA code.
